Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.intro: 6ï¸âƒ£ Here are 6 tips for how you can help Your Child learn how to cope with their emotions: LEARN, NOTICE, OPEN, TALK, SHARE and CARE
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.1.text:
1ï¸âƒ£ LEARN
ğŸ’¡ Learn about different emotions. There are 6 basic emotions, all of which provide us with a very specific message:  
ğŸ˜ƒHappy: Keep doing things that make you feel good.  
ğŸ˜”Sad: Something important in your life needs attention.
ğŸ”´Angry: Stand up for ourselves and set limits.
ğŸ˜£Disgusted: Move away from what we don't like.
ğŸ‘€Surprised: Stop and pay attention for a moment.
ğŸš©Afraid: Run away from danger.
ğŸ¨ As girls and boys get older, they learn to identify lots of other emotions, like feeling excited, frustrated, proud, lonely, peaceful, guilty, or confused.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.2.text:
2ï¸âƒ£ NOTICE
ğŸ‘€ Begin observing these 6 emotions in yourself and in Your Child.
ğŸ˜ƒğŸ˜’ğŸ˜”ğŸ˜£Notice how each emotion feels in your body.  
 
ğŸ˜ƒ You can also notice pleasant emotions such as a sense of peace, happiness, or calmness.
ğŸ’™ Noticing can also allow girls and boys to appreciate a beautiful moment or feeling of love!
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.3.text:
3ï¸âƒ£ OPEN
Be open, notice ğŸ‘€, and listen ğŸ‘‚ to Your Child when they share how they are feeling. 
ğŸ’› Accept how you and Your Child feel. Remember your and their bodies are sending messages about what you both are feeling. Recognize that feelings are important for both.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.4.text:
4ï¸âƒ£ TALK

ğŸ˜’ It is normal to have difficulty talking about and expressing emotions and feelings. 

ğŸ“ Remember, it is also normal to experience feelings in different ways.

â­ When Your Child is feeling an emotion, describe what you are observing in a calm way. For example, 
â€œI notice youâ€™re stomping your feet, talking loudly, and your face looks a bit upset. Are you feeling angry because you didnâ€™t get to play outside?â€
You can also help Your Child learn different emotions by using facial expressions and physical movements. Make it into a game
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.5.text:
5ï¸âƒ£ SHARE

ğŸ˜ƒ Share your own feelings with Your Child. 

For example, I would feel the same way if I couldnâ€™t go out when I wanted to. 

 ğŸˆThis sets a good example and shows Your Child that it's okay to share their own feelings.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.6.text:
6ï¸âƒ£ CARE

ğŸŒ· Use physical and verbal support to make Your Child feel accepted and loved. 

â­Jump with your boy or girl a little bit to shake out anger or take some deep breaths to calm down. These are some of the ways to deal with your emotions. 

ğŸ’š Remind Your Child that you are there for them and that they can always talk to you.

Improve My Relationship with My Child.introduction.msg_list: This lesson is about how we can stay calm and manage our anger when dealing with stressful moments with our girls and boys. ğŸ’š
Improve My Relationship with My Child.importance.msg_list:
As you began noticing feelings, you would have noticed feelings of anger, frustration or sadness. 

ğŸŒ· We love our girls and boys, but stress from caregiving and other events can make us feel angry. This is a normal part of life! 

ğŸ’¡ It is important for us to try to stay calm in order to help manage our anger so we do not hurt others.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.1.question: When I am angry at my boy or girl, I should show that I am angry so they stop misbehaving.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
ğŸ‰ Thatâ€™s correct! 

ğŸ’› It can be very difficult when your boy or girl is misbehaving, but you should try to manage your own stress and check your anger before doing anything. 

ğŸŒ± Taking deep breaths will help. Being angry may cause you to say or do things you will later regret.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
ğŸ‘€Oops! Good Try!

ğŸ’› It can be very difficult when your girl or boy is misbehaving, but you should try to manage your own stress and check your anger before doing anything. 

ğŸŒ± Taking deep breaths will help. Being angry may cause you to say or do things you will later regret.

Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.intro: There are four steps to keeping calm in stressful situations: BE CALM, QUICK, CLEAR, and POSITIVE.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.1.text:
1ï¸âƒ£ *BE CALM*

âœ… Be aware of your own feelings.

âœ…Take care of your emotions.

âœ…Remember your goal: make Your Child feel loved and secure.

âœ…Act effectively: Take a pause or a few breaths before asking Your Child to do something else.

âœ… Speak with Your Child in a calm voice.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.2.text:
2ï¸âƒ£ *BE QUICK*

â° There are other things you can do to help manage unwanted behavior before it becomes stressful. 

âœ¨Praise something positive that your boy or girl did today. 

âœ¨Understand their feelings. For example, it may feel boring to pick up toys after having fun or ending a big task. 

âœ¨Ask your girl or boy to do something else, and distract them before the unwanted behaviour begins or gets worse. 

âœ¨Invite Your Child in a chore you are doing. You can ask Your Child to think of a fun and quick way of doing the chores differently. 

ğŸ’¡ This is much easier than using consequences after they do something!
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.3.text:
3ï¸âƒ£ *BE CLEAR*

âœ… Rather than saying what you DONâ€™T want, tell your boy or girl what you DO want them to do.

For example, say:

âœ¨ â€œPlease speak more softly.â€

âœ¨ â€œRemember to walk inside the house.â€

This way, it is easier for them to follow! â­
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.4.text:
4ï¸âƒ£ *BE POSITIVE*

âœ… Praise your girl or boy when they behave well!

âœ… Redirecting your boy or girl to a positive behaviour will help you manage the situation.

âœ… It will also help them know what you expect from them!

Keep My Girl or Boy Safe and Healthy.comic.intro: {F3_UNCLE} wants to help his young nephew learn about safe and unsafe touch. Let's see how he has the conversation with his young nephew, {F3_SON_4}.
Keep My Girl or Boy Safe and Healthy.comic.text.1:
{F3_UNCLE}: Did you enjoy the story,{F3_SON_4}?

{F3_SON_4}: Yes, uncle! It was fun!
Keep My Girl or Boy Safe and Healthy.comic.text.2:
{F3_UNCLE}:  Now, there are some important things I want to talk to you about. It's about keeping your body safe and healthy.

{F3_SON_4}: What do you mean, uncle?
Keep My Girl or Boy Safe and Healthy.comic.text.3:
{F3_UNCLE}: First, we all have private parts on our bodies. These are the parts that are covered by our underwear. For boys, that includes the penis and testicles.

{F3_SON_4}: Like this? 

{F3_UNCLE}: Exactly. It's important to remember that these parts are private, no one should touch them except to keep you clean, and healthy or being inspected by a doctor in presence of your caregivers.
Keep My Girl or Boy Safe and Healthy.comic.text.4:
{F3_UNCLE}: Your body belongs to you, and you have the right to say 'no' if someone wants to touch you in a way that feels uncomfortable or wrong. Even if this person is a family member or a friend.

{F3_SON_4}: Okay, uncle.
Keep My Girl or Boy Safe and Healthy.comic.text.5:
{F3_UNCLE}: And if anything ever happens that makes you feel scared or uneasy, remember you can always come and tell me or Mommy. We're here to listen, protect you and keep you safe.

{F3_SON_4}: I will tell you and Mommy, uncle.

{F3_UNCLE}: We love you, {F3_SON_4}.  Now, let's give each other a big hug!

1ï¸âƒ£ **BREATHE: Take a pause**

ğŸŒ· It can be hard to see your girl or boy feeling upset or confused, but there is a lot you can do to support them.

Manage My Girl or Boy Behaviour.tips.intro: Dealing with anger is not easy ğŸ˜”. Maybe no one taught us how to manage our emotions and healthily express them.Here are 4ï¸âƒ£ tips you can use to manage your anger and communicate better with Your Child:
Manage My Girl or Boy Behaviour.tips.message.1.text:
1ï¸âƒ£ **NOTICE** 

How does anger feel in your mind and body?

When you are angry, you might feel like your heart is beating fast, you have racing thoughts in your head, your muscles are tense, or your face is feeling hot. You may feel like shouting, saying mean things, punishing, hitting, or breaking things. 

However, it is important to learn how to control your anger so that it does not result in someone getting hurt.
Manage My Girl or Boy Behaviour.tips.message.2.text:
2ï¸âƒ£ **UNDERSTAND**

Try to see what is making you angry. Take a pause or a few deep breaths, and ask yourself, â€œWhy is this situation bothering me so much?â€If you think you can not control your anger and may hurt someone, STOP and walk away from the situation. Allow yourself to calm down before responding. Remember to be kind to yourself and remind yourself that you can handle your emotions and anger without hurting anyone else.
Manage My Girl or Boy Behaviour.tips.message.3.text:
3ï¸âƒ£**MANAGE** 

If you need to manage your anger before you respond, you can always begin by taking a pause or a few deep breaths. If you are feeling more angry, you can distract yourself from some other tasks till the feeling passes away. For example, watching a funny or comforting video. If you are feeling very angry, doing something active helps you release your emotions. You can do some quick exercise, scream into a pillow in a private space, or talk to a loved one. You may need to try the strategy more than once until you feel less angry.
Manage My Girl or Boy Behaviour.tips.message.4.text: 4ï¸âƒ£**COMMUNICATE**Once you have calmed down, talk to Your Child about what happened. Explain the situation calmly and respectfully. Use the tips in this course to talk about household rules, and giving consequences.

Manage My Girl or Boy Behaviour.tips.intro: 3ï¸âƒ£ Here are three tips on how to help Your Child follow instructions more often:
Manage My Girl or Boy Behaviour.tips.message.1.text:
1ï¸âƒ£ **BE SPECIFIC**

â­Say the behaviour you want your girl or boy to do. For example: â€œPlease put your backpack on the chair when you enter the house, Luis.â€

ğŸ‘€Use your girlâ€™s or boyâ€™s name to get their attention. Go down to their level. Get their eye contact.
Manage My Girl or Boy Behaviour.tips.message.2.text:
2ï¸âƒ£ **BE REALISTIC**

â­Make sure that the instruction is something that your girl or boy can do. 

ğŸ’¡Give one instruction at a time. It can be difficult for Your Child to remember many instructions! 

â°If possible, give a transition warning to prepare the girl or boy for the end of an activity: â€œIn 3 minutes, it will be bedtime and you will give the cellphone back to me.â€

ğŸŒ·Stay calm and remember that expecting perfection adds extra stress for everyone. Instead, treat each moment as an opportunity to learn and teach.
Manage My Girl or Boy Behaviour.tips.message.3.text:
3ï¸âƒ£ **BE POSITIVE**

â­Use positive words when giving instructions. For example, instead of â€œDonâ€™t shout,â€ say â€œTalk in a quiet voice.â€

ğŸ’¡Give instructions in a firm voice and stay calm. Behave as if you expect your child to do what you ask.

ğŸ…**Praise, praise, praise!** Make sure you praise your child immediately when they follow your instructions.

Manage My Girl or Boy Behaviour.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: You should give Your Child what they want when they are whining about something or having a tantrum.
Manage My Girl or Boy Behaviour.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
â­ Thatâ€™s correct! 

Giving in to Your Child when they are demanding something, whining, or having a tantrum will only worsen it.

Your Child will learn they get their way when they behave that way.

Instead, try to find out what Your Child needs and give them plenty of positive emotional support without giving in to their demands if they are not reasonable. If you stay calm, they will stay calm, too.

Manage My Girl or Boy Behaviour.quiz.content.2.question: Last one! True or False: You should ignore Your Child to stop complaining and threaten to hit them if they continue.
Manage My Girl or Boy Behaviour.quiz.content.2.feedback_correct:
â­ Thatâ€™s correct! 

Telling your child to stop or threatening them might make things even worse. Also, hitting will only teach your child that violence is an acceptable solution to problems. It is also against the law. 

Instead of getting into a tug-of-war or fight with Your Child, explain calmly why and then try to redirect Your Child to something else. 

If Your Child continues or loses control, remain calm and stay with your child without arguing. It may be difficult, but eventually, your child will calm down, too. Then you can attend to their needs.

Manage My Girl or Boy Behaviour.tips.intro: 5ï¸âƒ£ Here are five steps to use when your child whines or throws tantrums:
Manage My Girl or Boy Behaviour.tips.message.1.text:
1ï¸âƒ£ **REDIRECT**

ğŸ¨ Try to redirect Your Childâ€™s attention to a positive behaviour or activity. 

ğŸŒ· Praise them for this positive behaviour!

You learnt about redirecting in the first course of Crianza con Conciencia +.
Manage My Girl or Boy Behaviour.tips.message.2.text:
2ï¸âƒ£**STAY CALM**

Take a Pause. Even a few deep breaths can make a difference. It will help you stay calm and be able to see clearly what Your Child needs.

It is very tempting (and, let's be honest, easy) to reduce your reaction to your childâ€™s level by shouting, especially when the tantrum doesnâ€™t stop or youâ€™re tired and your patience is running out.

Try to have a plan prepared for helping yourself in situations when you feel like you might explode and yell.

Stay near your child and be a reassuring presence. Your Child will also become calmer if you remain calm. It may not be easy to do, but it works!
Manage My Girl or Boy Behaviour.tips.message.3.text:
3ï¸âƒ£ **OBSERVE**

Ask yourself, â€œwhat does Your Child really need at this moment? Are they tired, stressed, afraid?â€ 

Most of the time, Your Child may need attention or love. 

You can give them this without giving into their demands if they are whining for something they cannot have.
Manage My Girl or Boy Behaviour.tips.message.4.text:
4ï¸âƒ£ **NURTURE**

ğŸˆ Once Your Child has stopped or calmed down from a tantrum, they will need lots of love and positive attention.

ğŸ§¸ You can talk later or the next day about what happened. For now, involve Your Child in a positive activity.
Manage My Girl or Boy Behaviour.tips.message.5.text:
5ï¸âƒ£ **BE CONSISTENT**

â­ Even if Your Child behaves even worse at first when you do not give in to them, it is important to stay calm without getting into an argument or shouting at Your Child. 

You can calmly explain the reason why your child cannot have something but do it only once without engaging in a debate or argument. 

Over time, Your Child will learn how to become calm by themselves.

ğŸ’š Spend lots of positive time with Your Child, especially. one-on-one time. It is super important!

Manage My Girl or Boy Behaviour.tips.intro: 4ï¸âƒ£ Here are four simple steps for using consequences when your boy or girl behaves disruptively:
Manage My Girl or Boy Behaviour.tips.message.1.text:
1ï¸âƒ£ **BE CALM**â— Every child should have a right to a life free from any form of violence. 

â— Shouting or hitting our girls and boys talso teaches them that it is okay to use violence when they are upset.

ğŸŒ· Take some deep breaths, take a pause, or walk away if you need to.

ğŸ’š Then, respond in a calm, clear way.
Manage My Girl or Boy Behaviour.tips.message.2.text:
2ï¸âƒ£ **BE FAIR**

ğŸ’¡ Before giving a consequence, give your girl or boy the option to behave and time to do as you asked.

ğŸ”„ Give a consequence connected to the behaviour. For example, if they do not pick up their toys, they cannot play with them later.

ğŸ”‘ Make sure you can follow through with the consequence. For example, tell them they canâ€™t play with their toys **today** or for the next hour, rather than for the whole week.ğŸ‘€ Notice if there is a natural consequence for their action already. This could be having to clean up the room after making a mess.If so, you might not need to give them one other consequence.
Manage My Girl or Boy Behaviour.tips.message.3.text:
3ï¸âƒ£ **BE CONSISTENT**

â¡ï¸ It is important to follow through with consequences for the rules you have set every time they do not follow them.

â­ This helps your girl or boy to know what to expect, and makes it more likely that they will follow the rule.

ğŸˆ Talk about the consequences for breaking household rules when you set them so that Your Child knows them and stick to them.
Manage My Girl or Boy Behaviour.tips.message.4.text:
4ï¸âƒ£ **BE POSITIVE**

ğŸ† Praise your boy or girl every time they do actions you want to see more of. This makes them more likely to repeat this behaviour!

âœ… See if you can avoid giving consequences at all by redirecting them to something else before they behave badly.

ğŸ‰ Using consequences can be hard at first, but will get easier with practice!

âœ¨ Consequences help our girls and boys learn responsibility for their actions - and to think before they act.

Manage My Girl or Boy Behaviour.tips.intro: 4ï¸âƒ£ Here are four tips to help you know your role as your girlsâ€™ and boysâ€™ caregiver and teach them their role, too:
Manage My Girl or Boy Behaviour.tips.message.1.text:
1ï¸âƒ£ **KNOW YOUR ROLE**

As a caregiver, your role is to make sure Your Child:
ğŸ”· has enough healthy food,
ğŸ”· has the clothes they need,
ğŸ”· stays safe from harm,
ğŸ”·has opportunities to go to school, 
ğŸ”·has medical attention when sick
ğŸ”· contributes to family needs, like doing chores, 
ğŸ”· learns the traditions and values you wish them to have, such as honesty,
ğŸ”· has opportunities to express themselves,
ğŸ”· has opportunities to play, and
ğŸ”· feels loved and supported, no matter what.
Manage My Girl or Boy Behaviour.tips.message.2.text:
2ï¸âƒ£ **TEACH**

Tell Your Child what their role in the family is. This can include:

ğŸ”¶ doing age-appropriate chores, like putting their toys away, making their beds, and sorting laundry,
ğŸ”¶ cooperating when their caregivers ask something of them,
ğŸ”¶ being respectful to others in the family,
ğŸ”¶ going to school and doing their homework, and
ğŸ”¶being part of family decisions.
Manage My Girl or Boy Behaviour.tips.message.3.text:
3ï¸âƒ£ **DO AS I DO**

ğŸ‘€ Your Child will learn from your actions much more than from the words you tell them. They notice more than you might think!

Prepare My Child for Success in School.importance.msg_list: Learning from our mistakes can help us avoid them in the future. It can also help us be more supportive of ourselves and less harsh when things do not go well. ğŸ˜ƒ

Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.intro: Here are four tips that you can use to help Your Child learn from their mistakes:
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.1.text:
1ï¸âƒ£ **TALK**

ğŸ‘‚ Create space and time for Your Child to talk with you about their life. 

ğŸ’™ If their day was challenging, listen to them and give them space to let them share.

ğŸ’› Give them support and show you care. Tell them, "that sounds difficult.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.2.text:
2ï¸âƒ£ **PRAISE EFFORT**

3ï¸âƒ£ **ALLOW FOR MISTAKES TO HAPPEN**

â“ It is tempting to want to solve every problem for Your Child, especially when you know better. This will not teach them to solve their own problems.

ğŸ˜ƒ Talk to Your Child about their mistakes and allow them to figure out a way to solve their problems and do better next time.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.4.text:
4ï¸âƒ£ **SHARE**

Prepare My Child for Success in School.introduction.msg_list:
Today, we will learn how to manage stress. Because this is such an important life skill, we will continue it tomorrow, too.

Stress is when you feel worried or tense because things might be difficult.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.importance.msg_list:
It is normal to feel stressed as a parent. But sometimes, stress can become overwhelming. 

This can feel like your brain is too full to do anything, and youâ€™re going to burst into tears, yell, or be too exhausted to function.

Learning to handle stress and asking for help when needed can help you.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.intro: ğŸ“Let's do a quiz to see what you already know about stress
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: Too much stress can have a negative impact on our relationships with others, including our children.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
ğŸ‰ You are right!

Too much stress can make you more aggressive, irritable and less patient with your children. 

It can also make it harder to get even the simple things done in your daily life.

But knowing this helps us find better ways to manage stress.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
ğŸ‘€Oops! Check it out!

Too much stress can make you more aggressive, irritable and less patient with your children. 

It can also make it harder to get even the simple things done in your daily life.

But knowing this helps us find better ways to manage stress.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.content.2.question: Letâ€™s do another one: When we ignore our stress, it will eventually go away.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.content.2.feedback_correct:
ğŸ‰ Thatâ€™s correct! 
ğŸ“When you feel stress, this is a sign from your body that you need to take care of yourself or that you need more support.

Itâ€™s important to pay attention to your thoughts and how your body is feeling so you can respond better
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.content.2.feedback_incorrect:
ğŸ‘€ Oops! Check it out! 

ğŸ“When you feel stressed, this is a sign from your body that you need to take care of yourself. 

Itâ€™s important to pay attention to your thoughts and how your body is feeling so you can respond better
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.content.3.question: Last one! True or False: When you have a lot to do and feel stressed, it's better to keep pushing through and not take breaks.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.content.3.feedback_correct:
ğŸ‰ Thatâ€™s correct! 
If you don't manage stress and keep pushing through without taking breaks, you can feel extremely exhausted. 

So, taking breaks and managing stress is not just about feeling better in the moment. It is also about preventing burnout in the long run.

If you don't manage stress and keep pushing through without taking breaks, you can feel extremely exhausted. 

So, taking breaks and managing stress is not just about feeling better in the moment. It is also about preventing burnout in the long run.

{F3_MOTHER} : {F3_DAUGHTER_7} and {F3_SON_4}, please take turns and share the phone.

{F3_SON_4}: But I had it first!

{F3_MOTHER}: Okay, now that we are all a bit calmer, we need some rules about using my phone. What do you think we should do?

Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.intro: Here are 4ï¸âƒ£ tips you can use to manage stress:
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.1.text:
1ï¸âƒ£ **NOTICE** 

What are you feeling in your body? When stressed most of the time, you can experience headaches, tiredness, or difficulty sleeping. 

Check in on your emotions. Stress can make you feel irritable, snap at loved ones, or want to be alone.

Take a moment to notice your thoughts. Stress can fill your head with racing, worrying, and negative thoughts.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.2.text:
2ï¸âƒ£**BE KIND** 

ğŸ’š When you begin feeling stressed, pause or take a few breaths. 

Say to yourself, â€œItâ€™s OK,â€ because it is OK to feel stressed - everyone does sometimes!

ğŸ Think about what would a loving friend or family member say to you.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.3.text:
3ï¸âƒ£ **HEALTHY HABITS** 

Taking care of your physical health will help you manage stress better. 

â¸ Try to get enough sleep every night - at least 7 or 8 hours if possible.

ğŸ Eat healthy foods as much as possible and maintain a balanced diet.

ğŸš² Find ways to move your body and get exercise every day. Even 10 minutes can make a difference.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.4.text:
4ï¸âƒ£ **RECHARGE** 

Take breaks during the day to recharge your energy. Small breaks can help, bit by bit.

Do things that help you relax and feel good, like practising taking a pause, listening to music, or going for a walk outside.

Spend time with friends or family members who care about you. Talking to someone you trust can make you feel better and less stressed.

Prepare My Child for Success in School.introduction.msg_list: Itâ€™s common for parents to feel stressed or overwhelmed when you have so much to do every day. In this lesson, you will continue learning ways to manage stress by making a plan in advance.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.importance.msg_list: Creating a plan for when you feel stressed can help you plan for and manage stressful situations when they happen.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.comic.intro: {F1_FATHER} is feeling stressed with the many things he needs to do. Letâ€™s see how {F1_FATHER} creates a plan:
Prepare My Child for Success in School.comic.text.1: {F1_FATHER} (thinking): There is so much to do! {F1_SON_5} is sick, and {F1_DAUGHTER_13} needs help for her school project. How will I manage?!
Prepare My Child for Success in School.comic.text.2: {F1_FATHER} (thinking): Let me take a pause first and take some deep breaths.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.comic.text.3: {F1_FATHER}: Okay, now let me write down all the things that need to be done. I need to get {F1_SON_5}â€™s medicine. I need to pay the bills that came in. Clean the house. Help {F1_DAUGHTER_13} with her project. Let {F1_SON_5}'s teacher know that he wonâ€™t be coming to class tomorrow.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.comic.text.4: {F1_FATHER}: Hmm.. this is too much to do. What is most important out of this? Helping my girl and boy is most important. Bills are not due until later this week, and I can clean on some other day.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.comic.text.5: {F1_FATHER}: Out of this, I need to make sure {F1_SON_5} gets the care he needs, so that is the first thing I will do. Once I am back, Iâ€™ll check in with {F1_DAUGHTER_13} to see what help she needs.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.comic.text.6: {F1_FATHER}:  Iâ€™ll spend 10 minutes cleaning the kitchen so Iâ€™m relaxed while making dinner, but Iâ€™ll save more cleaning for another day.  Iâ€™ll make a note for myself to pay the bill tomorrow afternoon so I donâ€™t forget! One step at a time. I can do this!
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.intro: Here are 5ï¸âƒ£ tips to help you make a plan when you are feeling stressed because you have too many things to do:
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.1.text:
1ï¸âƒ£ **WRITE OR DRAW** 

Grab a piece of paper, a notebook, or anything you can write on, and a pen.

Take a few minutes to jot down or draw out all the things you need to do today or throughout this week.

Make sure to include everything that comes to mind, like grocery shopping, helping your teen with school work, or going to the doctor.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.2.text:
2ï¸âƒ£ **DECIDE**Look at your list. 

Ask yourself, which tasks are urgent or really important? 

Put a star next to them. 

These are the things you should focus on first to make sure you don't forget anything important.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.3.text:
3ï¸âƒ£ **RANK** 

Of all the tasks you put a star to, which task is the most important or needs to be done first? Give it number 1. 

Then, look at the other tasks on your list and decide which one comes next. Give it number 2. 

Keep going until you have given all the starred tasks a number.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.4.text:
4ï¸âƒ£ **BREAK IT DOWN** 

If your urgent or important task is still making you feel overwhelmed and stressed, it might be too big to do all at once. 

That's okay! You can make it easier by breaking it into smaller steps.

For example, if you need to clean your house. That can seem like a lot to do! But if you break it down, like cleaning one room at a time, it's much easier.

By dividing the task into smaller parts, it's easier to work on and not as overwhelming. You can focus on each small step one at a time, which makes the whole task feel more doable.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.5.text:
5ï¸âƒ£ **ONE STEP AT A TIME** 

Begin with the number one task on your list. 

After you complete it, move to the next one. 

This helps you focus on the most important things first and ensures you don't forget anything.

Every now and then, take a moment to look at your plan. Check if anything has changed or if new things have come up.

Understand My Girl or Boy Development.tips.intro: 4ï¸âƒ£ Here are four tips that you can use to help Your Child learn from their mistakes:

2ï¸âƒ£ **EXPLORE SAFELY**

 ğŸš² Your Child will become more curious and will do more by themselves as they observe the world around them. Be aware of their activities, but encourage them to experience fun activities safely!

â­ Encourage Your Child to learn tasks independently, like combing hair, dressing themselves, or tying shoelaces. Show them how to do it safely by setting a good example.
Understand My Girl or Boy Development.tips.message.3.text:

âš½ Use games as a tool to teach Your Child about taking turns and sharing. They may not enjoy losing initially, but you can show them that the most important thing is to have fun.
